|exp_if_types = Mini PCI |exp_sim_num = |exp_pcmcia_num = |exp_expcard_num = |exp_minipci_num = 1 |exp_minipcie_num = |exp_usb_num = |exp_cf_num = |exp_sdmmc_num = |exp_ide_num = |exp_ata_num = |exp_sata_num = |exp_esata_num = |exp_parallel = |exp_sfp_num = |exp_M.2 = |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 9 |pwr_amp_dc = 1.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes,, internal,, 6-pin header,, (19200,8,N,1),, J213 |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bg |defaulip = 192.168.62.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = 1234 |defaultssid = WLAN |defaultssid_regex = ^WLAN$ |default_ch = |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 10/08/2003 |estreldate = 10/2003 |estprice = |upc = |ean = 4719571030038 |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = MSI MP54GS (MS-6818) |rad1modif = Mini PCI |rad1chip1 = Intersil;ISL3880; |rad1chip2 = Intersil;ISL3686A; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL, RP-SMA |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== *"760-05505006 VER:0D" is silkscreened on top the main board. :A sticker with "347 820-05505020 Ver.0E" printed on it is affixed to the bottom of the board. *"MS6818" and "VER:100" is silkscreened on the wireless module. :This wireless module is an [[MSI MP54GS (MS-6818)|'''MSI''' MP54GS (MS-6818)]]. The FCC ID of the wireless module has been assigned to this entry (there is none on the label). The firmware on the router used in this entry is 20-06-07T5, dated 2003-10-22. This device is assumed to be using the '''ThreadX''' RTOS based on cursory FW examination.. :The version string within the FW is '''Copyright (c) 1996-2001 Express Logic Inc. :â€¢ ThreadX LX4189/Green Hills Version G4.0.4.0 *''' ==Links of Interest== *[https://lkml.org/lkml/2004/4/22/72 '''(yet another) probable GPL violation''' on ''LKML''] :[http://lists.gpl-violations.org/pipermail/legal/2005-March/000020.html Same author w/ another message on the ''gpl-violations.org'' mailing list] :the ISW054u would appear to be the same device with a USB port ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== 
J213
(TxD) (GND)
(...) (...)  --> R side (+ end) of board
(RxD) (GND)
{{/Serial info}} ==Pictures==
